title: Trump demands 'immediate negotiations' to acquire Greenland but 'won't use force'
subhead: Trump was speaking at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, which has been dominated by his claim over the Danish territory.

Marine Le Pen insists party acted in 'good faith' at appeal trial
subhead: The French far-right leader claimed in a Paris appeals court that her political party and its members did not do anything intentionally wrong in an embezzlement scandal at the European Parliament over the course of 12 years. She sought to shift blame onto the Parliament for being too 'lenient.'

title: Syria's government gives Kurds more time to reach an agreement
subhead: A four-day ceasefire was declared after Syrian forces continued their advance in the province of Hassakeh. They took control of prisons holding Islamic State fighters and the Al-Hol camp.

title: 'The Wizard of the Kremlin': An epic tale of power through the eyes of a man in the shadows
subhead: Director Olivier Assayas seeks to shed light on how Russia came to fall under the grip of Vladimir Putin, played by Jude Law.

title: Affordability has become a dominant political issue in the US
subhead: After months of dismissing rising prices as a 'Democratic scam,' Donald Trump is now making a series of announcements aimed at making, as the midterm elections approach.

subhead: In Uzhhorod, a border city near Slovakia, exhausted and disillusioned residents have long stopped believing in victory and expect little from ongoing diplomatic talks. They only hope that the war will end, even 'if it means sacrificing a piece of the country to be saved.'

title: In one year, Trump has imposed a culture of impunity
subhead: Since returning to the White House, the American president has exempted himself from all rules, both domestically and internationally. This sense of impunity now permeates his entire administration.

title: 'Why War?': How thinkers answer this heartbreaking question
subhead: Since the bloodbath of World War I, philosophers have repeatedly grappled with the question: Is war an irrepressible human urge, or the product of historical and social forces?
